titles.title: Congratulating and commending the Veterans of Foreign Wars.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Mr. Smith (NJ) moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 108.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/28/2004--Introduced. Recognizes the historic significance of the 105th anniversary of the founding of the Veterans of Foreign Wars of the United States (VFW). Congratulates the VFW on achieving that milestone. Commends the approximately 2,000,000 veterans who belong to the VFW and thanks them for their service to their fellow veterans and the Nation.
